CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ATTENTION: Mr S Cole, Head of Procurement

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Time accounting or human resources software package. Software package and information systems. Personnel and payroll services. The University wishes to procure a replacement for it's HR and Payroll system through a tendered project for the supply and managed implementation of an integrated software solution.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The system solution must provide comprehensive HR and payroll support to the University’s diverse organisation. Payroll capability must include the ability to handle casual payroll processing. Full on-line recruitment functionality is required. The system should offer streamlined transaction processing and workflow management options along with state of the art capability in paperless processing and self service functionality. Data structures must provide flexibility throughout the solution and in support of integrated reporting capability to meet all HR and payroll reporting and information requirements of the institution; including statutory and regulatory reporting, flexibly tailored and standard form management information as well as regular monitoring reports. There should be integrated solutions for the modeling of payroll and staffing complement forecasting. The solution should include effective and flexible control of processes, data and structures and should provide secure access and multiple options for the segregation and control of functionality. All aspects of the solution must provide intuitive, easily navigable user interfaces that facilitate efficient processing and maintenance routines and provide for easily and quickly executed enquiries. The proposed solution must provide flexible interface options for a variety of core business systems including but not limited to; student records, finance, and research management.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: A performance bond and/or parent company guarantee may be required. Details will be included in the tender documentation.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: A pre-qualification questionnaire and information pack (PQQ) will be obtainable on our e- tendering site: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/universityofsussex. Completed applications should be completed and returned electronically to the University of Sussex no later than noon on Monday 28.2.2011.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: (a) Appropriate statements from banks or, where appropriate, evidence of relevant professional risk indemnity insurance.

(b) The presentation of balance-sheets or extracts from the balance-sheets, where publication of the balance-sheet is required under the law of the country in which the economic operator is established.

(c) A statement of the undertaking's overall turnover and, where appropriate, of turnover in the area covered by the contract for a maximum of the last three financial years available, depending on the date on which the undertaking was set up or the economic operator started trading, as far as the information on these turnovers is available.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Names and professional qualifications of proposed staff, list of similar agreements or contracts within the HE or public sector with references. Statements of technical resources, previous experience, manpower, equal opportunities and race relations policy, quality assurance procedures, membership of professional trade bodies.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The contracting authority may accept variant bids in addition to a standard bid as set out in the tender/contract documents provided the contracting authority's core requirements are met and provided the variant is submitted in accordance with the tender/contract documents. Requests to participate must be made by the completion and return of the Pre-Qualification questionnaire by the date and time specified in section III 2.1 and in accordance with the instructions set out in the PQQ. Completed PQQ's submitted after the deadline may not be considered. The dates and times periods specified in this notice are only provisional and the contracting authority reserves the right to change at any time. The contracting authority reserves the right not to award any or part of this contract. Any costs incurred in the preparation or the provision of bids will not be refunded by the contracting Authority. GO Reference: GO-2011120-PRO-2132568.

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: In accordance with Regulation 32 (information about contract award procedures and the application of the standstill period prior to contract award) and Regulation 47 (Enforcement of obligations) the Public Contract Regulations 2006.
